byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Al Baker, David W. Chen, Sandra E. Garcia, James C. McKinley Jr., William K. Rashbaum and Noah Remnick, and research by Susan C. Beachy.
byline.original: By RICK ROJAS and EMMA G. FITZSIMMONS

abstract: Construction crane collapses in Manhattan's TriBeCa neighborhood, killing pedestrian David Wichs, injuring three others, and scattering debris over wide radius; rapid collapse of crane occurred when operating crew attempted to lower it due to high winds during snowstorm.
lead_paragraph: Workers were trying to secure the crane amid high winds when it toppled onto Worth Street in TriBeCa shortly before 8:30 a.m. Friday, Mayor Bill de Blasio said.

headline.main: Crane Collapse in Lower Manhattan Kills One Person
headline.print_headline: Crane Collapse Kills Man on Busy Manhattan Block

snippet: Workers were trying to secure the crane amid high winds when it toppled onto Worth Street in TriBeCa shortly before 8:30 a.m. Friday, Mayor Bill de Blasio said.
